intro: Triaristella reichenbachii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces flowers in shades of white, purple, and pink. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
